metadata.notes: A series of three sermons focusing on the transition from darkness/doubt to revelation.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. The preacher avoids 'must' and 'shame' language, focusing instead on the human condition of grief and doubt.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher does not use the pulpit to scold or demand moral performance. Even when discussing 'sin,' it is framed as a state from which one is raised rather than a list of failures.
quotes: We are accustomed to hearing stories of Jesus turning away from people who will not believe... so it is startling when he graciously appears.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. The preacher validates pain without offering 'pious platitudes' or creating dependency.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The Nurturing Parent is present through empathy for the bereaved and the doubting. It promotes autonomy by acknowledging that the preacher also struggles.
quotes: It is a very comforting thing to me, in my own struggle to believe...
These little comforts are the best that we can do to cope with our grief and loss.

adult.score_explanation: 10 = Strong Adult presence. The preacher uses literary analysis and historical context to process the 'data' of the text.
adult.analysis: The preacher addresses the listener as a thinking subject, acknowledging modern skepticism and scientific reality (evolution) while maintaining the integrity of the text.
quotes: You don’t have to reject evolutionary science to understand the symbolic meaning of this.
Thomas stands for all of us here... We would like proof.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. The preacher encourages 'shaking a fist' at God, which is the opposite of the Adapted Child's compliance.
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher explicitly rejects the 'trained from birth not to question God' stance, inviting an authentic rather than a compliant response.
quotes: Our God is a God who permits us to doubt, to complain, to shake our fist, to shout at him.

free_child_FC.score_explanation: 10 = Authentic, playful, joyful. The FC is present in the awe of 'things too wonderful,' though the tone remains serious.
free_child_FC.analysis: The Free Child manifests as 'wonder' and 'mystery' rather than playfulness. It is the source of the 'Alleluia' and the fascination with the 'beasts of the field.'
quotes: Things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher primarily shares information and personal struggle, inviting the listener to reflect on their own experience of 'night' and 'doubt.'
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Minimal. The preacher is transparent about the difficulty of the texts.
transaction_analysis.purity_explanation: 10 = Completely transparent. The preacher avoids the 'Bait & Switch' of many Easter sermons by not demanding a sudden emotional high.
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: There is a slight risk of a 'Nurturing Parent -> Child' transaction where the preacher 'rescues' the listener from their doubt too quickly with the 'Who' answer.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: The preacher avoids 'ITHY' (I'm Only Trying To Help You) by explicitly rejecting 'pious platitudes' and 'soothing explanations.' By admitting his own struggle, he levels the playing field, preventing the 'NIGYSOB' dynamic.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Low. He refuses to provide the 'why' that would 'save' the listener from the pain of the tornado story.
preacher_roles.persecutor: None. No blame is assigned for doubt or suffering.
preacher_roles.victim: Low. He identifies with the 'dust' and 'doubt,' but from a position of strength/Adult rather than helplessness.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is invited to be 'Adults' who face the 'Victim' reality of death without staying stuck in it.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers an escape through 'Revelation'—moving from the Triangle to Autonomy (Faith).

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: This sermon series is psychologically robust. It avoids the common ecclesiastical game of 'Bait and Switch' (promising happiness, delivering duty). Instead, it validates the listener's 'Adult' reality of suffering and doubt while offering a 'Nurturing Parent' perspective of hope. It promotes autonomy by allowing the listener to 'shake their fist' at God, thereby moving past the 'Adapted Child' stage of religion into an authentic 'Free Child' wonder.
strengths: Validation of doubt and pain as healthy components of faith.
High level of transparency regarding the preacher's own ego state.
areas_for_improvement: The transition from the 'Why' to the 'Who' could be seen as a slight 'Rescuer' move if not handled carefully.
More 'Free Child' spontaneity could balance the heavy 'Adult' processing of grief.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Continue to use 'I' statements regarding struggle. This maintains the Adult-Adult transaction and prevents the preacher from slipping into a 'Rescuer' role who has all the answers.
